meta.title: Everything You Need to Know About ORB and How I Use It - Webinar

He is wearing a grey t-shirt with the letters "MAX" on it. He also has a bun and a necklace on. On the chart is a line graph, seemingly in a downtrend. In the upper right hand corner of the screen is the current time, which is 1:05 PM.

visual.description: The man starts to talk about the strategies, going into the different tools that can be used. The chart is still visible.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: what you're looking at anymore. How many of you have three different momentum oscillators on your chart and they're all reading the same exact thing, yet for some reason, you think you're seeing confluence between your MACD, your stochastics, your RSI, your EMAs, you're all of that. You have the same thing, copy pasted four times on your chart. Does everyone see my chart here? Everyone can see this beautiful wealth chart I have up here.

visual.description: The man uses the chat to describe the tools and strategies. He is telling the audience to not have too many indicators on their chart.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: This beautiful wealth chart is all I need. And when I say that, I mean that. I don't need any indicators. I don't want to trade with any indicators. I want to trade on the 15 minute time frame down to the one to two minute time frame. And I'm going to show you guys exactly how I do it every single day.

visual.description: The man states that he doesn't need anymore tools, so he focuses on the 15 to two minute scale. The chart is still visible.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: The most important thing you need to do is start on the 15 minute time frame. Now, there is total interpretation with the opening range breakout. You can try the 5 minute, you can try the 15 minute. There's some people that love the 30 minute, whatever floats your boat. Remember what I say is what I do, but what I say to you, you need to make it yours, because I cannot trade for you.

visual.description: The man states the importance of starting on the 15 minute time frame. He then describes the importance of trading for yourself.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: I don't have the same risk management you have. I don't have the same emotional management you have, and I don't have the same uh uh size management that you have. Every one is unique and every trade is unique. So you have to trade your game. So when I teach you this and show you this, make it yours, Find out which time frame you like the best, but I'm gonna show you how I do it. The first thing I'm going to do every single day is look at this 9:30 candle right here. This beautiful 9:30 candle. I do not care what happens from 4:01 PM today until 9:29 AM tomorrow. I don't want to know what happened in the pre-market. I don't want to know what happened in the after hours. I don't care. I don't want to know, of any foreseen news. I don't care about any earnings reports. I don't want to know nothing. All I want to know is live price action when the markets are open, because what do we tend to do? How many of you are guilty of this? You saw an earnings report, you saw a big move overnight. We're up 250 points and you said, man, this thing's going to dump. People are going to take profit right at 9:30. I'm going short right at the open. There's no way it can keep going up. 9:30 opens and you see the biggest green candle you've ever seen. You went from 250 to 350 green and you cooked yourself. Why? Why?

visual.description: The man describes his trading strategy and what he does. He states that he wants to lose the pre-market bias. The man gives a psychological tip.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: Because you formulated a bias without nothing technical, with nothing analytical, you just looked at a bunch of numbers on a chart and made an opinion. That is how traders lose before the market even open. And one thing for us to do, a psychological tip is what? It's hard to become reactive instead of being proactive whe when you become proactive, you it's hard to flip to a reactive mindset.

visual.description: The man gives an important tip about making an opinion about trading.

timeline.speaker: SPEAKER_01
timeline.transcript: It's very tough to hit that reverse button when you know you're wrong, because a lot of traders love to hit that DCA button instead. Why do we keep putting our eggs in a basket that has holes in it the size of, of softball, sorry, of softballs instead of putting our eggs in a basket that's made out of gold.

visual.description: The man continues on the psychological tip describing the importance of the tip and making sure you're not making assumptions. The chart is still visible.
